title: 104_hr834
content:
There is no text provided in the prev_chunk, so I will summarize the curr_chunk directly:

"PROVISIONS RELATING TO OFFICES AND POSITIONS IN THE EXECUTIVE OR LEGISLATIVE BRANCH." This section applies to certain offices or positions under specified sections of the Federal Salary Act of 1967. It establishes the rate of basic pay for these offices or positions, maintaining the current rate until a specified date and then adjusting it thereafter. The section establishes the rate of basic pay for certain offices or positions under specified sections of the Federal Salary Act of 1967. It maintains the current rate until a specified date and then adjusts it thereafter. It also repeals certain related provisions of the Ethics Reform Act of 1989. The section establishes the rate of basic pay for certain offices or positions under specified sections of the Federal Salary Act of 1967, maintaining the current rate until a specified date and then adjusting it thereafter. It also repeals certain related provisions of the Ethics Reform Act of 1989. The term "election of Representatives" is used in the same way as in the twenty-seventh amendment to the US Constitution. SEC. 2. PROVISIONS RELATING TO OFFICES AND POSITIONS IN THE JUDICIAL BRANCH. This section applies to offices or positions under the Federal Salary Act of 1967. The basic pay rate for these offices or positions will remain unchanged for a specific period before transitioning to a new rate. The Federal Salary Act of 1967 applies to offices or positions, with the pay rate remaining unchanged for a specific period before transitioning to a new rate based on the rate payable to a judge of a district court of the United States. Adjustments in pay for an office or position will be made in accordance with applicable provisions of law. The Federal Salary Act of 1967 mandates that pay adjustments for offices or positions will be based on the rate of pay for a judge of a district court of the United States after a specific period. Repeal of Section 225 of the Federal Salary Act of 1967. Repeal of Section 225 of the Federal Salary Act of 1967, along with technical and conforming amendments to related sections in various codes. Amendments made to sections 5, 44(d), 135, and 252 of title 28, United States Code, under section 5318.
